summary:
Summary of Material Information:

  • Agreement Details: Genesis, Mercury, Meridian, and Contact signed 10-year Huntly Firming Options (HFOs), each securing 50 MW (total 150 MW) of backup generation capacity at Huntly Power Station.
  • Fuel Reserve: Genesis will establish a 600,000-tonne solid fuel reserve (initially coal, transitioning to biomass) to support energy security during dry winters.
  • Commercial Impact: Supports delaying decommissioning of a 240 MW Rankine unit (to 2035 vs. 2026); ensures grid stability and wholesale price moderation.
  • Regulatory Status: Subject to Commerce Commission review; intended effective date 1 January 2026.

No capital raising, financial data, or trading halt implications identified.

(Omitted: Operational specifics, executive quotes, background details.)

Quarterly Sales Announcement Summary:
- 2Q Sales: $192.9M (+2.07% YoY); 1H Sales: $371.3M (99.8% of prior year).
- Online Sales Share: 19.97% in 2Q (vs. 19.83% prior); 19.36% in 1H (vs. 18.77% prior).
- NPAT Guidance: ≥$29M for 1H, with H2 expected to outperform.
- Inventory: Below prior year levels.
- Margins: Under pressure due to economic conditions.
- Key Date: Half-year results on 10 September 2025 (interim dividend declared).

Omitted: Operational commentary, non-material segment details.

• Strategic Energy Reserve Agreement: Meridian Energy, Genesis, Mercury, and Contact have agreed to establish a strategic energy reserve at Huntly Power Station to address gas shortages and ensure electricity system security.
  • Key Rationale: Mitigates dry-year risk and supports price stability; aligns with Meridian’s renewable generation investments.
  • Next Steps: Subject to Commerce Commission review; intended effective date of 1 January 2026.
  • Access for Others: Genesis plans to allow other parties to secure reserve arrangements post-review.

No material trading or capital markets-specific details (e.g., financial terms, capital impact) disclosed.

No material information identified

(Note: The announcement pertains only to a non-executive director appointment, which does not materially impact valuation, liquidity, or capital structure.)

• Response to NBIO (Non-Binding Indicative Offer):
  • Board rejects $2.30/share offer from BGH Capital and Trouchet family consortium as undervalued.
  • Believes fair value exceeds $3.00/share, citing cyclical lows and strategic initiatives.

  • Remains open to improved offers.

  • FY25 Financial Guidance:

  • Underlying NPAT expected at lower end of analyst range ($27.0M–$34.4M), per 4 July 2025 guidance.
  • Statutory NPAT likely a loss due to potential impairments:
    • Up to $36M (pre-tax) in USA goodwill impairment ($27M post-tax).
    • Up to $21M in deferred tax write-offs (USA/UK).

(Omitted: Operational details, director names, and jurisdictional footnotes as non-material.)

Growth Roadmap Announcement – Material Information:

  • Financial Target: Aims to achieve >$100M NPAT within 3-4 years (FY28–FY29). Key assumptions:
  • Rental days growth: ~25% (vs. FY25), still below pre-COVID (FY19) levels.
  • Debt reduction: Over $100M decrease in net debt (ex-IFRS16).
  • Fleet expansion: ~9,000 vehicles by FY28 (vs. 8,500 in FY25).

  • NZ tourism EBIT: Expected ~50% decline from FY28 due to Waitomo Glowworm Caves lease expiry (June 2027).

  • Strategic Initiatives:

  • UK & Ireland review: Potential divestment to release capital (~650-vehicle fleet).
  • Australasian manufacturing: 20% cost gap (NZ vs. AU); AU operations under optimization.

  • North America: Accelerating synergy project post US-Canada tariff removal; targeting 15% ROFE.

  • Rental Revenue:

  • FY26 forward bookings show double-digit growth (ex-USA); NZ/AU bookings +25% YoY.

  • Risks Highlighted: Tourism demand, tariffs, execution of initiatives, and competition.

Next Update: Full FY25 results on 25 August 2025.

Omitted: Operational details, historical performance breakdowns, disclaimer boilerplate.
